In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Certainly! Below is an example of how you might define the `wrap_string` function in Julia to wrap text at a certain width:

```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width::Int = 10)
    lines = Vector{String}()
    for line in eachline(text)
        words = split(line)
        current_line = ""
        for word in words
            if length(word) + length(current_line) > text_width
                push!(lines, current_line)
                current_line = word
            else
                current_line *= " " * word
            end
        end
        if current_line != ""
            push!(lines, current_line)
        end
    end
    return lines
end
```

This function takes a `String` as input and returns an array of strings, where each string is no longer than the specified `text_width`. If you call this function with a text argument, it will return an array of lines that do not exceed the specified width.
